text: David Sergio Trezeguet (; ; born 15 October 1977) is a French-Argentine former professional footballer who played as a striker. ==Career statistics== ===Club=== Appearances and goals by club, season and competition Club Season League Cup Continental Other Total Division Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Apps Goals Platense 1993–94 Primera División 3 0 — — — 3 0 1994–95 2 0 — — — 2 0 Total 5 0 — — — 5 0 Monaco 1995–96 Division 1 4 0 0 0 — 1 0 5 0 1996–97 5 0 0 0 — — 5 0 1997–98 27 18 3 1 9 4 2 1 41 24 1998–99 27 12 1 0 5 2 2 0 35 14 1999–2000 30 22 1 0 6 2 1 0 38 24 Total 93 52 5 1 21 8 6 1 125 62 Juventus 2000–01 Serie A 25 14 2 0 5 1 — 32 15 2001–02 34 24 2 0 10 8 — 46 32 2002–03 17 9 1 0 10 4 0 0 28 13 2003–04 25 16 3 1 5 4 1 1 34 22 2004–05 18 9 1 1 5 4 — 24 14 2005–06 32 23 0 0 9 6 1 0 42 29 2006–07 Serie B 31 15 1 0 — — 32 15 2007–08 Serie A 36 20 3 0 — — 39 20 2008–09 8 1 1 0 4 0 — 12 1 2009–10 19 7 0 0 8 3 — 27 10 2010–11 0 0 0 0 1 0 — 1 0 Total 245 138 16 2 57 30 2 1 320 171 Hércules 2010–11 La Liga 31 12 0 0 — — 31 12 Baniyas 2011–12 Pro-League 3 0 0 0 — 1 0 4 0 River Plate 2011–12 Primera B Nacional 19 13 2 1 — — 21 14 2012–13 Primera División 16 3 0 0 — — 16 3 Total 35 16 2 1 — — 37 17 Newell's Old Boys 2013–14 Primera División 24 7 0 0 6 2 — 30 9 Pune City 2014 Indian Super League 9 2 0 0 — — 9 2 Career total 445 227 23 4 82 40 9 2 559 273 ===International=== Appearances and goals by national team and year National team Year Apps Goals France 1998 12 2 1999 2 1 2000 12 9 2001 7 5 2002 7 3 2003 8 8 2004 7 1 2005 5 2 2006 8 3 2007 2 0 2008 1 0 Total 71 34 :Scores and results list France's goal tally first, score column indicates score after each Trezeguet goal.
